name: Titanium.Geolocation
summary: The top level Geolocation module. The Geolocation module is used for accessing device location based information.

events.name: calibration
events.summary: Fired when the device detects interface and requires calibration.
events.description: When this event is fired, the iOS calibration UI is being displayed to the end user.

events.name: heading
events.summary: Fired when an heading update is received.

properties.name: code
properties.summary: If success is false, the error code is available.

properties.name: success
properties.summary: Indicate if the heading event was successfully received. Android returns this since SDK 7.5.0.

properties.name: error
properties.summary: If success is false, a string describing the error.

properties.name: heading
properties.summary: Dictionary object containing the heading data.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: location
events.summary: Fired when a location update is received.

properties.name: code
properties.summary: if success is false, the error code if available.

properties.name: success
properties.summary: Indicates if location data was successfully retrieved.

properties.name: provider
properties.summary: If success is true, object describing the location provider generating this update.

properties.name: coords
properties.summary: If success is true, actual location data for this update.

properties.name: error
properties.summary: If success is false, a string describing the error.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: locationupdatepaused
events.summary: Fired when location updates are paused by the OS.
events.description: This event is fired when pauseLocationUpdateAutomatically is set to true and if the OS detects that the device's location is not changing, causing it to pause the delivery of updates in order to shut down the appropriate hardware and save power.

events.name: locationupdateresumed
events.summary: Fired when location manager is resumed by the OS.
events.description: When location updates are paused and need to be resumed (perhaps because the user is moving again), this event is fired to let the app know that it is about to begin the delivery of those updates again.

events.name: authorization
events.summary: Fired when changes are made to the authorization status for location services.
events.description: This event is fired whenever the application's ability to use location services changes. Changes can occur because the user allowed or denied the use of location services for the app or the system as a whole.

properties.name: authorizationStatus
properties.summary: New authorization status for the application.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Function to invoke on success or failure. Optional on SDK 10, as this method will return a Promise, which may be used to handle the result.

returns.summary: On SDK 10+, this method will return a Promise whose resolved value is equivalent to that passed to the optional callback argument.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Function to invoke on success or failure of obtaining the current heading. Optional on SDK 10, as this method will return a Promise, which may be used to handle the result.

returns.summary: On SDK 10+, this method will return a Promise whose resolved value is equivalent to that passed to the optional callback argument.

methods.name: getCurrentPosition
methods.summary: Retrieves the last known location from the device.
methods.description:
On Android, the radios are not turned on to update the location, and a cached location is used.

On iOS the radios may be used if the location is too "old".

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Function to invoke on success or failure of obtaining the current location. Optional on SDK 10, as this method will return a Promise, which may be used to handle the result.

returns.summary: On SDK 10+, this method will return a Promise whose resolved value is equivalent to that passed to the optional callback argument.

methods.name: hasLocationPermissions
methods.summary: Returns true if the app has location access.

parameters.name: authorizationType
parameters.summary: Types of geolocation's authorizations. This is an iOS only parameter and is ignored on Android.

methods.name: requestLocationPermissions
methods.description:
On Android, the request view will show if the permission is not accepted by the user, and the user did not check the box "Never ask again" when denying the request. If the user checks the box "Never ask again," the user has to manually enable the permission in device settings. If the user asks for permissions or tries to get unauthorized location information, then the app should call the request method to show the permission settings. This method requests Manifest.permission.ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION on Android. If you require other permissions, you can also use requestPermissions.

In iOS 8, Apple introduced the Info.plist keys NSLocationWhenInUseUsageDescription and NSLocationAlwaysUsageDescription that are used to display an own description while requesting location permissions. In addition to this method, you need to include one of these keys (based on how your location updates should behave) or the application will crash if your app does not.

In iOS 11, Apple introduced another Info.plist key NSLocationAlwaysAndWhenInUseUsageDescription that allows developers to upgrade their permissions from "When in Use" to "Always". In order to get the best usability for iOS 11 and later, request "When in Use" first and upgrade your location-permissions by requesting "Always" permissions later if required. If this permission-flow is not used, iOS will still ask the user to select between "When in Use", "Always", and "Don't Allow" (primary action) on iOS 11 when asking for "Always" permissions, which can lead to a higher frequence of denied permissions, so be careful requesting location permissions. The iOS 11 related upgrade-flow is available in Titanium SDK 6.3.0 and later.

Finally, iOS 11 and later will require you to always include the NSLocationWhenInUseUsageDescription permission and Titanium will throw a descriptive error-log if any required keys are missing.

More infos:

  • Available Info.plist keys
  • Request Always Authorization

parameters.name: authorizationType
parameters.summary: Types of geolocation's authorizations. This is an iOS only parameter and is ignored on Android.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Function to call upon user decision to grant location access. Optional on SDK 10, as this method will return a Promise, which may be used to handle the result.

returns.summary: On SDK 10+, this method will return a Promise whose resolved value is equivalent to that passed to the optional callback argument.

methods.name: requestTemporaryFullAccuracyAuthorization
methods.summary: Requests the user's permission to temporarily use location services with full accuracy.
methods.description:
If your app doesn't have permission to access accurate location (see locationAccuracyAuthorization, you can use this method to request temporary access to accurate location. This access will expire automatically, but it won't expire while the user is still engaged with your app. So, for example, while your app is in the foreground your app will retain the temporary access it was granted. Similarly, if your app starts a Continuous Background Location session with the background location indicator enabled (see showBackgroundLocationIndicator, your access to accurate location will remain as long as the background location indicator remains enabled.
This allows your app to provide session-oriented experiences which require accurate location (e.g. fitness or navigation), even if the user has decided not to grant your app persistent access to accurate location.

You need to add key NSLocationTemporaryUsageDescriptionDictionary in tiapp.xml. See following example -

<ti:app>
    <ios>
        <plist>
            <dict>
                <key>NSLocationTemporaryUsageDescriptionDictionary</key>
                <dict>
                    <key>PurposeKey1</key>
                    <string>
                        Specify the reason for accessing the user's location data with full accuracy.
                        This appears in the alert dialog when asking the user for permission to
                        access their location.
                    </string>
                    <key>PurposeKey2</key>
                    <string>
                        Specify the reason for accessing the user's location data with full accuracy.
                        This appears in the alert dialog when asking the user for permission to
                        access their location.
                    </string>
                </dict>
            </dict>
        </plist>
    </ios>
</ti:app>

When CoreLocation prepares the prompt for display, it will look at the NSLocationTemporaryUsageDescriptionDictionary key in your tiapp.xml. The value should be a dictionary containing usage descriptions. The purposeKey you provide to this method must correspond to an entry in that dictionary.

parameters.name: purposeKey
parameters.summary: A key in the NSLocationTemporaryUsageDescriptionDictionary dictionary of the app's tiapp.xml file. The value for this key is an app-provided string that describes the reason for accessing location data with full accuracy.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Function to call upon user decision to grant authorization.

methods.name: reverseGeocoder
methods.summary: Tries to resolve a location to an address.
methods.description: The callback receives a ReverseGeocodeResponse object. If the request is successful, the object includes one or more addresses that are possible matches for the requested coordinates.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.summary: Latitude to search, specified in decimal degrees.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.summary: Longitude to search, specified in decimal degrees.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Function to invoke on success or failure. Optional on SDK 10, as this method will return a Promise, which may be used to handle the result.

returns.summary: On SDK 10+, this method will return a Promise whose resolved value is equivalent to that passed to the optional callback argument.

properties.name: accuracy
properties.summary: Specifies the requested accuracy for location updates.
properties.description:
For basic location updates on all platforms, set accuracy to either:

  • ACCURACY_HIGH for higher-quality location updates, with the higher power consumption.
  • ACCURACY_LOW for lower-quality location updates with lower power consumption.

For finer-grained control on iOS, specify one of ACCURACY_BEST, ACCURACY_NEAREST_TEN_METERS, ACCURACY_HUNDRED_METERS, ACCURACY_KILOMETER, or ACCURACY_THREE_KILOMETERS.

For finer-grained control on Android, use manual mode, instead of specifing an accuracy. This mode requires more active management on the part of the application, but it is recommended to maximize accuracy and battery life. See Titanium.Geolocation.Android for details on using manual mode.

properties.name: activityType
properties.summary: The type of user activity to be associated with the location updates.
properties.description: The information in this property is used as a cue to determine when location updates may be automatically paused. Pausing updates gives the system the opportunity to save power in situations where the user's location is not likely to be changing. For example, if the activity type is ACTIVITYTYPE_AUTOMOTIVE_NAVIGATION and no location changes have occurred recently, the radios might be powered down until movement is detected again.

properties.name: allowsBackgroundLocationUpdates
properties.summary: Determines if the app can do background location updates.
properties.description: When UIBackgroundModes include location in tiapp.xml, this property is set to true by default.

properties.name: distanceFilter
properties.summary: The minimum change of position (in meters) before a 'location' event is fired.
properties.description: If set to 0, distance filtering is disabled, meaning that location events are generated continuously.

properties.name: frequency

deprecated.notes: Android legacy mode operation is deprecated. For new development, use either simple mode or manual mode. See "Configurating Location Updates on Android" in the main description of this class for more information.

properties.summary: Requested frequency for location updates, in milliseconds.
properties.description: Setting a frequency value enables legacy location mode on Android. Note that only a single provider can be active at one time in legacy mode. Note that the frequency value is used as a guideline: there are no guarantees that the device will provide updates at the specified frequency. A lower frequency value generally increases power consumption. A value of 0 means that updates should be generated as quickly as possible.

properties.name: hasCompass
properties.summary: Indicates whether the current device supports a compass.

properties.name: headingFilter
properties.summary: Minimum heading change (in degrees) before a heading event is fired.
properties.description: Set to a value greater than zero to reduce the number of heading events generated.

properties.name: lastGeolocation
properties.summary: JSON representation of the last geolocation received.
properties.description: LastEvent is the JSON version of the last geolocation sent by the OS. This does not trigger a geolocation attempt, nor wait for such. If no geolocation has happened, this value may be null or undefined.

properties.name: locationAccuracyAuthorization
properties.summary: A value that indicates the level of location accuracy the app has permission to use.
properties.description: If the value of this property is ACCURACY_AUTHORIZATION_FULL, you can set any constant to accuracy. If value is ACCURACY_AUTHORIZATION_REDUCED setting accuracy to a value other than ACCURACY_REDUCED has no effect on the location information.

properties.name: locationServicesAuthorization
properties.summary: Returns an authorization constant indicating if the application has access to location services.
properties.description: If locationServicesAuthorization is AUTHORIZATION_RESTRICTED, you should not attempt to re-authorize: this will lead to issues.

properties.name: locationServicesEnabled
properties.summary: Indicates if the user has enabled or disabled location services for the device (not the application).
properties.description:
This method returns true if any location provider is enabled.

On Android, there is a "passive" location provider that is enabled at all times, even when the user disables both the GPS and Network location providers. Therefore, this method returns true on these devices if only there is GPS or network provider available.

properties.name: pauseLocationUpdateAutomatically
properties.summary: Indicates whether the location updates may be paused.
properties.description: Allowing the location updates to be paused can improve battery life on the target device without sacrificing location data. When this property is set to YES, the location updates are paused (and powers down the appropriate hardware) at times when the location data is unlikely to change. For example, if the user stops for food while using a navigation app, the location manager might pause updates for a period of time. You can help the determination of when to pause location updates by assigning a value to the activityType property.

properties.name: preferredProvider

deprecated.notes: Android legacy mode operation is deprecated. For new development, use either simple mode or manual mode. See "Configurating Location Updates on Android" in the main description of this class for more information.

properties.summary: Determines the preferred location provider.
properties.description: Setting a preferred provider enables legacy location mode on Android. Note that only a single provider can be active at one time in legacy mode. The preferred provider affects power consumption. In general, PROVIDER_GPS requires the most power, and PROVIDER_PASSIVE requires the least. If undefined, the preferred provider is auto-detected.

properties.name: showBackgroundLocationIndicator
properties.summary: Specifies that an indicator be shown when the app makes use of continuous background location updates.
properties.description:
Starting continuous background location updates requires the app to set UIBackgroundModes to include "location" and to set this property to true before calling getCurrentPosition with the intent to continue in the background.

Note that this property only applies to apps with Always authorization. For apps with WhenInUse authorization, the indicator is always shown when using continuous background location updates in order to maintain user visibility and that the app is still in use.

properties.name: showCalibration
properties.summary: Determines whether the compass calibration UI is shown if needed.
properties.description: Set to false to disable display of the compass calibration UI. This may result in invalid heading data.

properties.name: trackSignificantLocationChange
properties.summary: Indicates if the location changes should be updated only when a significant change in location occurs.
properties.description:
The trackSignificantLocationChange service offers a low-power location service for devices with cellular radios.

This service offers a significant power savings and provides accuracy that is good enough for most applications. It uses the device's cellular radio to determine the user's location and report changes in that location, allowing the system to manage power usage much more aggressively than it could otherwise. This service is also capable of waking up an application that is currently suspended or not running in order to deliver new location data.

constants.name: ACCURACY_AUTHORIZATION_FULL
constants.summary: The user authorized the app to access location data with full accuracy.

constants.name: ACCURACY_AUTHORIZATION_REDUCED
constants.summary: The user authorized the app to access location data with reduced accuracy.

constants.name: ACCURACY_BEST
constants.summary: Use with accuracy to request the best accuracy available.
constants.description:
Using this value results in the most accurate location updates, and the highest battery usage.

Using this value on Android enables legacy mode operation, which is not recommended.

constants.name: ACCURACY_BEST_FOR_NAVIGATION
constants.summary: Use with accuracy to request highest possible accuracy and combine it with additional sensor data.
constants.description: Using this value is intended for use in navigation applications that require precise position information at all times and are intended to be used only while the device is plugged in.

constants.name: ACCURACY_HIGH
constants.summary: Use with accuracy to request more accurate location updates with higher battery usage.
constants.description: Using this value on Android enables simple mode operation.

constants.name: ACCURACY_HUNDRED_METERS
constants.summary: Use with accuracy to request location updates accurate to the nearest 100 meters.
constants.description: Using this value on Android enables legacy mode operation, which is not recommended.

constants.name: ACCURACY_KILOMETER
constants.summary: Use with accuracy to request location updates accurate to the nearest kilometer.
constants.description: Using this value on Android enables legacy mode operation, which is not recommended.

constants.name: ACCURACY_LOW
constants.summary: Use with accuracy to request less accurate location updates with lower battery usage.
constants.description: Using this value on Android enables simple mode operation.

constants.name: ACCURACY_NEAREST_TEN_METERS
constants.summary: Use with accuracy to request location updates accurate to the nearest 10 meters.
constants.description: Using this value on Android enables legacy mode operation, which is not recommended.

constants.name: ACCURACY_REDUCED
constants.summary: The level of accuracy used when an app isn’t authorized for full accuracy location data.
constants.description: Use with accuracy. The accuracy of location data is reduced in both space and time using approaches like selecting a nearby point of interest and updating the location at most a few times per hour. The approximate location preserves the user’s country, typically preserves the city, and is usually within 1–20 kilometers of the actual location. If your app is authorized to access location information with full accuracy, you can use this constant to access location data as if the app didn’t have that authorization.

constants.name: ACCURACY_THREE_KILOMETERS
constants.summary: Use with accuracy to request location updates accurate to the nearest three kilometers.
constants.description: Using this value on Android enables legacy mode operation, which is not recommended.

constants.name: ACTIVITYTYPE_AUTOMOTIVE_NAVIGATION
constants.summary: The location data is used for tracking location changes to the automobile specifically during vehicular navigation.
constants.description: Used with activityType. This activity might cause location updates to be paused only when the vehicle does not move for an extended period of time.

constants.name: ACTIVITYTYPE_FITNESS
constants.summary: The location data is used for tracking any pedestrian-related activity.
constants.description: Used with activityType. This activity might cause location updates to be paused only when the user does not move a significant distance over a period of time.

constants.name: ACTIVITYTYPE_OTHER
constants.summary: The location data is being used for an unknown activity.

constants.name: ACTIVITYTYPE_OTHER_NAVIGATION
constants.summary: The location data is used for tracking movements of other types of vehicular navigation that are not automobile related.
constants.description: Used with activityType. You would use this to track navigation by boat, train, or plane. Do not use this type for pedestrian navigation tracking. This activity might cause location updates to be paused only when the vehicle does not move a significant distance over a period of time.

constants.name: AUTHORIZATION_ALWAYS
constants.summary: A locationServicesAuthorization value indicating that the application is authorized to start location services at any time. This authorization includes the use of all location services, including monitoring regions and significant location changes.

constants.name: AUTHORIZATION_AUTHORIZED
constants.summary: A locationServicesAuthorization value indicating that the application is authorized to use location services.

constants.name: AUTHORIZATION_DENIED
constants.summary: A locationServicesAuthorization value indicating that the application is not authorized to use location services, or location services are disabled.

constants.name: AUTHORIZATION_RESTRICTED
constants.summary: A locationServicesAuthorization value indicating that the application is not authorized to use location servies and the user cannot change this application's status.

constants.name: AUTHORIZATION_UNKNOWN
constants.summary: A locationServicesAuthorization value indicating that the authorization state is unknown.

constants.name: AUTHORIZATION_WHEN_IN_USE
constants.summary: A locationServicesAuthorization value indicating that the application is authorized to start most location services only while running in the foreground.

constants.name: ERROR_DENIED
constants.summary: Error code indicating that the user denied access to the location service.

constants.name: ERROR_HEADING_FAILURE
constants.summary: Error code indicating that the heading could not be determined.

constants.name: ERROR_LOCATION_UNKNOWN
constants.summary: Error code indicating that the user's location could not be determined.

constants.name: ERROR_NETWORK
constants.summary: Error code indicating that the network was unavailable.

constants.name: ERROR_REGION_MONITORING_DELAYED
constants.summary: Error code indicating that region monitoring is delayed.

constants.name: ERROR_REGION_MONITORING_DENIED
constants.summary: Error code indicating that region monitoring is denied.

constants.name: ERROR_REGION_MONITORING_FAILURE
constants.summary: Error code indicating a region monitoring failure.
